newsitem.title: USA: NYCE cotton called to open 0.20 cent higher.
newsitem.headline: NYCE cotton called to open 0.20 cent higher.

text.p: NYCE cotton futures were called to open 0.20 cent a lb higher on Friday based on market orders at 1019 EDT, traders said.
The market is expected to follow-through on gains made on the previous close.
Thursday, the benchmark December contract closed 0.58 cent firmer at 74.78 cents per lb, having ranged from 74.85 to 74.15 cents. The rest of the board finished 0.40 to 0.60 cent higher.
An estimated 6,000 lots changed hands on the day.
Nearby resistance was pegged at 75.00 cents, dealers said, adding that a move over the key level could attract fund buying that would carry the contract sharply higher.
Support in December was pegged at 74.00 cents.
